<summary> The invention relates to a process for depositing calcium phosphate coatings on implantable medical devices, particularly stents, to minimize immune response and allow controlled release of medicinally active agents. The process involves sol-gel deposition of hydroxyapatite coatings at low temperatures, resulting in flexible and porous coatings with high bonding strength. Various deposition techniques, such as aerosol-gel processing, electrophoretic deposition, and electrochemical deposition, can be used to achieve different coating characteristics. The coatings can be tailored to control drug release rates and can be applied to a variety of metallic and non-metallic implantable devices. </summary>

<summary> The present invention provides a nerve guidance conduit (NGC) for nerve regeneration, featuring a spiral structured porous sheet with integrated surface channels and aligned nanofibers. The NGC includes reserved chambers at the ends to reduce tension during suturing, and a dense outer fibrous tube for mechanical support. The NGC is tunable in size and shows superior mechanical properties, cell proliferation, and nerve regeneration compared to traditional methods. Animal studies demonstrate improved motor function, nerve conduction, muscle reinnervation, and neural tissue coverage with the NGC. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to seat base support assemblies for furniture, particularly sinuous band seat spring assemblies, providing dynamic uplift and resilience through rail connectors that combine torsioning, expansion-contraction, and leverage-amplification features. The connectors can be used with various seat base support means, such as wire grids or chord-rubber webbing, to enhance seat performance characteristics. </summary>

<summary> The disclosed anvil assembly for a surgical stapling device includes a stabilizing collet positioned within the anvil shaft to prevent damage to the flexible legs during attachment to the stapling device. The collet is substantially rigid and includes cantilevered fingers with protrusions that secure it within the anvil shaft. The anvil shaft also includes splines and stabilization rings for proper orientation and stability. When the trocar of the stapling device is inserted, the flexible legs flex outwardly to secure the anvil assembly, with the collet supporting the legs and inhibiting deformation. The collet does not interfere with the flexing of the legs, allowing for reliable attachment of the anvil assembly to the stapling device. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a container for a blender with high-speed blades mounted inside. Early blenders had glass containers, but manufacturers switched to reinforced plastic due to durability and cost efficiency. However, plastic containers could accumulate debris and compromise hygiene. To address this issue, a metal lining was introduced to shield the inner wall of the receptacle. The lining includes teeth to grind fibers of vegetables and fruits, reducing stirring time and preserving the color, luster, and nutrition of the juice. Different embodiments of the container feature various designs, such as half-mask or whole-mask linings, prop stands, and horizontal rings for stability and convenience. </summary>

<summary> The document describes a garnish pick with appendages that can serve as skewering shafts or hooks for securing the pick to a food or beverage container. The pick is designed to prevent it from becoming submerged in a beverage and to make it easier to remove garnishes without touching them. Various embodiments of the garnish pick are shown in different configurations, including curved shafts, multiple skewering shafts, and hooks for glass rims. The pick may be made of different materials and have different shapes and sizes. The document also describes a specific embodiment of a garnish pick with multiple appendages for skewering garnishes and a hook for securing the pick to a beverage container. The pick body may include stem portions, elongate body portions, and tapered skewers for holding garnishes. The pick may be asymmetric and have an outer coating made of a different material than the core. The document concludes by stating that variations, combinations, and equivalents of the disclosed embodiments are possible. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a combined cardiomyostimulator and cardiac pacer-cardioverter-defibrillator for cardiac assist systems. It includes a device and algorithm for delivering stimulation to a skeletal muscle grafted around the heart, sensing depolarizations of the heart, and measuring intervals between successive depolarizations. The system inhibits muscle stimulation upon sensing certain intervals, detects arrhythmias based on interval ranges, and delivers appropriate therapy. The system features muscle stimulation during defibrillation charging to maintain cardiac output and decrease defibrillation thresholds. Different muscle stimulation bursts can be used, including muscle catch and pulse train bursts. The system ensures reliable sensing of cardiac events and prompt detection and treatment of arrhythmias. Overall, the system provides rapid detection of cardiac arrhythmias and cardiac assistance during arrhythmic episodes. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an accommodating intraocular lens device designed for implantation in a lens chamber of a subject's eye. The device comprises a lens chamber, a base lens, and a lens periphery coupling the two. The lens chamber is elastically deformable and filled with a fluid or gel, providing accommodative power. The base lens provides corrective refractive power and is more rigid than the lens chamber. The device is resiliently biased to an unaccommodated state but actuates to an accommodated state in response to radial compressive forces. Various embodiments include features such as through-holes, raised protrusions, and different materials with varying Young's modulus. The IOL is intended for implantation in the capsular bag of the eye, centered along the optical axis, and designed to provide a range of accommodation up to 15 diopters. </summary>

<summary> The invention is an esophageal-stomach displacement electrode designed to be inserted into a patient's esophagus and stomach to stimulate the heart. The electrode includes a semi-rigid plastic tube with an electrode at the distal end, controlled by a mechanism to bend and press against the stomach wall. By displacing the stomach wall towards the heart, the electrode can be positioned closest to the ventricle for more efficient pacing or defibrillation. The control mechanism at the proximal end of the tube allows for precise manipulation of the electrode's position. The electrode can be easily withdrawn after use by releasing tension on the control mechanism. The invention provides a non-invasive and convenient method for placing the electrode close to the heart, reducing the energy required for medical procedures. Modifications can be made to the design without departing from the scope of the invention. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a board game with a lake theme, where players move tokens around a board to acquire lake areas, boat dealerships, and dams. Players can improve their properties by adding lake cabins and marinas, and must pay rent to other players when landing on their properties. The game continues until all but one player goes bankrupt, with the remaining player declared the winner. </summary>

<summary> The invention describes an apparatus and method for treating tissues and wounds by combining fluid supply and suction drainage, with features such as eliminating hydrostatic pressure, intermittent fluid administration, and detection of bleeding during treatment. The apparatus includes a movable rest for fluid reservoirs, an injection port for intermittent fluid supply, and a drainage port with an open grid to prevent blockage, while the method involves controlling fluid flow rates, maintaining suction pressures, and monitoring fluid formation to detect bleeding. </summary>

<summary> The gravity driven steerable vehicle is designed for downhill racing on varied terrain, with a prone riding position and a stable, durable design. The vehicle can have wheels, skis, or a combination of both, with a suspension system for precise control in turns. The invention provides advantages over existing patents by offering improved steering, braking, and maneuverability. The vehicle can be retrofitted with components for use on snow-covered terrain, with features like ski assemblies, braking systems, and suspension mechanisms. The integrated body and frame design simplifies assembly and repair, while the double arm independent suspension system enhances handling and control. The ski pivot action and braking systems contribute to improved performance and control in various snow and ice conditions. Overall, the invention offers a versatile and efficient solution for gravity-driven vehicles on different terrains. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to Radial Reflection Diffraction Tomography for imaging objects using wave-based algorithms. Conventional ultrasound imaging techniques suffer from limitations in detecting plaque types. The invention utilizes a wave-based imaging method to characterize plaque in arteries, determining the risk of rupture and thrombosis. The method can also be used for non-destructive evaluation in boreholes and identifying buried wastes. The Hilbert Space Inverse Wave algorithm is employed for reconstructing images based on collected data. The method involves mapping angular locations and frequency parameters to construct images of objects. The HSIW algorithm allows for the inversion of the scattering operator to estimate object functions. The flexibility of the HSIW method allows for various transducer configurations and frequencies to be used in the reconstruction process. </summary>

The present invention concerns a biological oil composition derived from a marine copepod, particularly rich in stearidonic acid (SDA), eicosapentaenoic acid (EPA), and docosahexaenoic acid (DHA). This oil composition differs significantly from traditional fish oil and krill oil in its chemical composition, containing high levels of wax esters and astaxanthin. Studies on female mice fed diets containing the copepod oil showed a significant reduction in atherosclerotic plaque formation compared to diets with concentrated EPA/DHA. The copepod oil also had a notable effect on lowering blood cholesterol levels in the mice. The oil composition is proposed for use in dietary supplements, functional foods, and pharmaceutical products for the prevention and treatment of cardiovascular diseases. Further research is needed to understand the mechanisms behind the unique biological effects of this copepod oil.

<summary> 
The invention relates to pharmacological compositions containing polyelectrolyte complexes in microparticulate form with active substances embedded in the matrix. These complexes can be composed of biocompatible, biodegradable polyacids and polybases, with the active substance either embedded, absorbed, chemically bound, or a partner in the complex. The particles can be prepared in various sizes and are suitable for controlled release of active substances like cytostatics, proteins, vaccines, and contrast agents for ultrasonic diagnosis. Release tests show controlled and sustained release profiles for different active substances incorporated in the polyelectrolyte complex particles. 
</summary>

<summary> The invention is a golf ball teeing device that allows golfers to insert a tee into the ground with a ball on top without bending over. It eliminates the need for a manually controlled unclamping mechanism and can be attached to a golf club grip. The device is lightweight, portable, and easy to use, allowing for quick teeing up of a ball and retrieval of the tee. It is made of flexible plastic material and utilizes a delayed urging means to securely hold the ball and tee in place. </summary>

<summary> The present document describes a person support apparatus, such as a hospital or long-term care bed, with a mechanism for adjusting the height and orientation of the patient support frame. The apparatus includes leg assemblies with linear actuators for adjusting the height and inclination of the deck support frame. The deck support frame features inverted U-shaped channel elements with rollers that run along the inner surface of the channels for stability and smooth movement. The design reduces friction, minimizes the risk of trapping fingers, and prevents dirt accumulation. The apparatus can be adjusted to different positions, including Trendelenburg and reverse Trendelenburg positions. Additionally, a braking mechanism is incorporated into the castors to lock the wheels in place when the deck support frame is lowered. Various embodiments and modifications are possible within the scope of the disclosure. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a skin reflectance measuring apparatus specifically designed for measuring skin reflectance. It uses fiber optics for flexibility and miniaturization, allowing for measurements on small skin surfaces. The apparatus compensates for variations in emitted light and ambient light to provide accurate measurements. The reflectance value is calculated from specular and diffuse reflection values, with a scale of reflectance ranging from 0 to 1000. Tests conducted on individuals showed a correlation between visual appearance and measured reflectance, demonstrating the effectiveness of the apparatus in quantifying skin reflectance. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a dental cleaning and massaging apparatus that provides hydraulic cleaning of teeth and massaging of gums. The apparatus includes a mouthpiece with upper and lower channel members, bite blocks, air-sacks for massaging, and hoses for water and suction. Control box allows for operation with air, water, or both, and a remote control device is provided for convenience. The apparatus is designed to provide effective cleaning and massaging for dental health. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to pelvic floor reconstruction using implants, specifically addressing the issue of reliable anchoring of the mesh implant during surgical procedures for pelvic organ prolapse. The invention includes anterior and posterior implants with straps for threading into ligaments, as well as a specialized needle for threading the straps through tissues from the accessible side, improving surgical outcomes. </summary>

The second embodiment of the apparatus is designed to handle patients with varying respiratory mechanics, abnormal chemoreceptor reflexes, or hypoventilation syndromes. It includes features such as fuzzy logic algorithms for detecting sudden changes in leakage flow, adjusting the time constant for leak conductance calculations, and calculating the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle. The apparatus also incorporates fuzzy inference rules for triggering pressure changes based on respiratory patterns and leak conditions. Overall, the apparatus aims to provide tailored ventilatory assistance to match the subject's specific respiratory needs.

<summary> The invention is an electro-surgical dissecting and cauterizing instrument for laparoscopic/endoscopic procedures, with a rigid arm extending between the working tip electrode and the insulating sleeve to improve visibility and prevent unintentional cauterization of healthy tissue. The instrument is connected to an electro-surgical unit and includes various working tip electrode configurations such as a hook or spatula for different surgical applications. The arm is laterally offset from the sleeve's longitudinal axis, allowing for maximum visualization of the working tip electrode and operation site. Different embodiments of the instrument are shown with varying arm lengths and angles to accommodate different surgical needs. The insulating jacket on the arm prevents unintended contact with healthy tissue, making the instrument safe and effective for surgical procedures. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a magnetic resonance imaging apparatus that allows for high-contrast exposures in a short time, even for larger body segments. The apparatus includes a magnet, patient receptacle, support plate, transmit and receive coils, and an adjustment unit to determine and store adjustment parameters before exposures. By storing adjustment parameters and executing exposures in a separate process, high-contrast images are obtained without the need for repeated adjustments, leading to reduced examination times and improved patient safety. The apparatus can be used for various forms of magnetic resonance imaging, such as peripheral angiography, to track contrast agent doses over larger body regions with minimal interruption. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a fastener for albums, such as photographic albums and scrapbooks, allowing for easy insertion and removal of pages. The fastener consists of strap anchors attached to the front and back covers, a strap passing through aligned apertures in the covers and pages, and a releasable connection between the strap and anchors to adjust the length for variable album thickness. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a lightweight and durable sulky designed for trotting races, with a frame made of light metal and easily assembled from flat elements. The end frames are casted and the shafts, crossbar, and wheels are all fastened in the same vertical plane for optimal load distribution. The crossbar is extruded aluminum with strengthening elements for stability, and the mounting bushings allow for easy assembly with simple tightening of screws. The end frames are identical and can be used on either side of the sulky, making it easy to assemble and pack for storage and transportation. Overall, the sulky offers a 40% weight reduction compared to traditional sulkies while maintaining strength and stability. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a ventilation system for rotating water feeds, particularly in water-cooled generators with coaxial feed and discharge ducts. The system aims to remove air bubbles that can cause overheating and blockages in the cooling system. By providing bypasses with inlets around the axis of rotation, air bubbles are automatically removed by utilizing pressure gradients. Different embodiments of the bypasses are shown, including arrangements in end faces of feed pipes, radially arranged pipes, and coiled pipes. The bypasses are designed to increase hydrodynamic resistance and minimize bypass flow. Overall, the ventilation system simplifies the removal of air bubbles in rotating water feeds. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a steering column for a motor vehicle with a jacket unit supporting a steering shaft and a retaining part connected across an energy absorption and break-away connection. The jacket unit is displaceable in the event of a crash to absorb energy. The steering column is adjustable in length and height or inclination. The retaining part is connected with the jacket unit through a bending wire or strip that is elastically prestressed to absorb energy. The break-away connection is released if a force exceeding a limit value is applied to the steering shaft. The energy absorption connection and break-away connection provide a simple and cost-effective solution to decrease force peaks during a crash. The design also helps prevent shaking and vibrations in normal driving conditions. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a method for installing curved glass panels in vehicle windows using flat, uncontoured glass. The conventional process of pre-contouring and tempering glass panels is expensive and results in brittle glass that is prone to shattering in accidents. The new method involves flexing the flat glass to conform to the curved window opening and securing it in place with resilient clips and a reveal molding. Adhesive sealant is applied between the glass panel and the window opening to permanently fix the glass in place. The method allows for the use of inexpensive flat glass panels, reducing costs for consumers. The flexing of the glass panel creates an urgency that allows for the insertion of adhesive sealant behind the glass. The glass panel is held in place by the fastening means until the adhesive cures, permanently securing the glass in its curved shape. The method is applicable to various vehicle windows and provides a cost-effective and efficient way to install curved glass panels. </summary>

<summary> The invention is an apparatus for removing gas from a liquid, particularly oxygen from water on offshore platforms. The apparatus includes multiple gasification chambers with mechanisms for ingesting and mixing a second gas into the liquid to displace the first gas. The method involves introducing the liquid into the chambers, ingesting the second gas, creating a turbulent area, and removing the displaced gas from the vapor space. The apparatus offers advantages such as reduced vessel height requirements, efficient gas removal, and applicability to various liquids and gases. </summary>

<summary> The disclosure relates to a packaging machine with multiple work stations arranged in succession, each with a movable tool member. The machine includes a shaft driven in the production direction, with transfer mechanisms converting the shaft's rotation into tool movements. The transfer mechanisms may include toggle levers or cam mechanisms with wear-reducing elements. The shaft can drive tool members in forming, sealing, and cutting stations, with the option for vertical displacement of tool members. The machine design allows for compactness and synchronization of tool movements. Additional features include symmetrical arrangement of transfer mechanisms and a frame for shaft support. The disclosure also describes a second embodiment with multiple work stations and a common shaft for driving tool members. </summary>

The document describes a disposable finishing article assembly with a drive member permanently affixed to a grinding wheel, allowing for quick attachment and release to a power tool without the use of adhesives. The assembly includes a backing flange, a retaining nut, and a pressure cap to securely hold the grinding wheel in place during operation, providing smooth and vibration-free performance.

<summary> The invention is a hydraulic unit for a vehicle brake system with a pump driven by an electric motor. Pressure fluid entrained by the pump pistons is diverted away from the motor and collected in spring chambers. A pressure equalization conduit between the spring chambers and the motor prevents water from entering the unit. The design allows for cost savings and a hermetic seal of the unit. Different exemplary embodiments show variations in the design for pressure fluid diversion and pressure equalization. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to power and free conveyor systems for transferring carriers between predetermined paths. By providing selectively operable second and third dogs on the carriers, transfers can be achieved over short or long distances. The third dog is normally held out of operative position by the track but can be brought to operative position for transferring the carrier. The system allows for efficient and cost-effective transfers without changing the elevation of the tracks. Dogs can be operated simultaneously or sequentially depending on the desired transfer distance. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a conductive liner for railroad car center plate assemblies, eliminating the need for separate grounding apparatus. The liner is made of ultra high molecular weight polyethylene mixed with 2% carbon black for conductivity. The liner fills the space between the center plate and truck bolster bowl, providing self-lubricating properties and electrical conductivity. Different embodiments include a dished bowl liner and a flat horizontal disk liner. The conductive liner improves mechanical and electrical properties, meeting both lubrication and conductivity standards. The design ensures proper swiveling action of the car trucks while discharging any electric charge buildup.</summary>

<summary> The invention is a gate valve designed for dispensing viscous substances from flexible bags or pouches, allowing for one-handed operation. It features a tubular sleeve with a reciprocating gate at the outlet end, providing variable flow control and a complete cut-off. The gate and guide are curved complementally for effective sealing when closed. The valve can be disassembled for cleaning and reassembled easily. It is mounted on the spout of a bag and can be used in fast-food restaurants or similar settings. The valve assembly includes a spout insert mounting sleeve, a gate valve guide member, and a gate valve member. The valve can be operated with one hand by engaging the lugs on the gate and guide. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a vehicular rearview mirror system that can adapt to different protocols of a vehicle control output. The system includes a mirror control responsive to the vehicle control output, such as gear status information, engine information, alarm information, or door status information. The mirror control uses a microcomputer to determine the protocol by software processing. The system also includes a power-up sequence and a main sequence to adjust parameters based on the vehicle operation. The system utilizes a logical sequence of events to determine the protocol of the vehicle control output. The software-based protocol determination technique allows for the same mirror system to be used in different vehicles with varying protocols. The system is cost-effective as it can be implemented in software using existing microcomputer resources. The invention provides a flexible and efficient solution for adapting rearview mirror systems to different vehicle protocols.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an anti-lock braking system for motorcycles, specifically focusing on systems for the front wheel. The system includes an anti-dive device in the front suspension to control the contraction of the front fork in response to braking force. This helps to minimize variations in angular deceleration of the front wheel and improve braking efficiency. The system also includes an anti-lock control unit to regulate hydraulic pressure to prevent wheel lock. The anti-dive device works in conjunction with the anti-lock control unit to enhance braking performance and reduce chassis vibration. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to movable partitions and panels for separating or insulating cargo during transportation or storage, particularly for multi-temperature transport. Current partition systems in refrigerated trailers are typically modular and mounted in channels on the floor. Insulated bulkheads are used to separate cargo areas at different temperatures. The improved partition system includes panels independently attached to mounting assemblies, allowing for independent movement. The panels can be slidably attached to ceiling-mounted rails, raised and secured to the ceiling when not in use. Various modifications can be made to the rail and trolley system, mounting mechanisms, and locking mechanisms without departing from the invention. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a sanitizable rotary valve designed for use in liquid chromatography to separate and purify biological macromolecules. The valve features a novel diaphragm seal that allows for in-place sanitization without disassembly. The valve is designed to be used in conjunction with a carousel system for continuous simulated counter-current flow in chromatographic separations. The design of the valve allows for efficient separation and purification processes while maintaining a sterile condition. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to gas-liquid contacting trays and valve-tray assemblies for improved efficiency. The invention addresses the problem of restricted disengagement of vapor retained in the liquid on trays. It includes directional thrust valves mounted on tray surfaces to control liquid flow and enhance vapor-liquid contact. The valves are designed to reduce back-trapping of liquid and promote directional thrust of vapor. The invention increases tray efficiency by reducing retrograde flow and turbulence. The design allows for higher valve density and improved mass transfer between gas and liquid. Overall, the invention provides a method and apparatus for enhanced vapor-liquid flow efficiency in process columns. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a fluid pressure regulator assembly that generates power while regulating fluid pressure. It aims to reduce variances in output pressure due to large differences in input pressure, is inexpensive to manufacture and maintain, lightweight, and portable. The assembly includes a vane pump to convert pressurized fluid into mechanical power. The vane motor is described in detail, along with its components and operation. Various embodiments of the invention are discussed, including applications in a gas grill, scuba diving gear, and a vehicle driven by pressurized fluid. The invention allows for the extraction of work from pressurized fluid while reducing pressure, potentially reducing the need for larger or more expensive regulators.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a pallet system designed to support and secure trays loaded with items for shipping. The pallet system includes raised guide rails to prevent lateral movement of the trays, end stops to limit longitudinal movement, and end plates for added stability and protection. The trays can be easily loaded and unloaded by sliding them onto the pallet along the guide rails. The components of the pallet system, such as the pallet cap and end plates, are customizable for different types of loads. The system is designed to be efficient, secure, and suitable for automated loading and unloading processes. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to an electrical driven flying saucer based on magnetic suspension for aviation aircrafts. The design focuses on compact structure, reasonable layout, and high power conversion efficiency. The rotary-wing system includes magnetic suspension rotary-wing wheels, electromotive ring, magnetic suspension shaft, and guide rail. The system utilizes repulsive or attractive magnetic suspension bearings for stability. The electric engine is a permanent magnet synchronous motor for efficient operation. Improvement options include coaxial axial dual or radial dual magnetic suspension systems to overcome reactive torque. The design ensures stability, controllability, and power performance of the flying saucer. The use of superconducting materials can enhance magnetic suspension capabilities. Overall, the design aims to optimize space utilization, reduce energy consumption, and ensure operational safety. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to streptavidin muteins with improved binding affinity for peptide ligands, produced using recombinant DNA technology. These muteins are used for isolating, purifying, and determining biological substances, particularly recombinant proteins. The muteins have mutations in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53, resulting in higher binding affinity for specific peptide ligands. The invention also includes nucleic acids, vectors, and cells transformed with these muteins, as well as methods for their production and use in various applications such as affinity chromatography and detection methods. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to methods of forming substituted guanidines using nickel catalysts, particularly nickel in the zero oxidation state. Guanidines are important in drug development and the methods aim to provide high yields under mild reaction conditions. The use of nickel catalysts reduces the need for toxic reagents and allows for catalyst recovery and reuse. Various guanylating agents, such as thioureas and isothioureas, can be used in the reactions. The methods have been successfully tested with different amines and pyrrolidines, resulting in high yields of guanidines. Different nickel catalysts, such as nickel-phosphide alloy and nickel on kieselguhr, have been shown to be effective in catalyzing the reactions. Overall, the methods offer a cost-effective and environmentally friendly approach to synthesizing substituted guanidines.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires, providing colored oxide coatings with excellent weatherability. The process involves anodizing the aluminum strip or wire, then electrolytically coloring it in a bath containing specific salts or acids. The apparatus includes baths for degreasing, etching, anodic oxidation, electrolytic coloring, and sealing, with the aluminum strip or wire continuously passing through each bath. By controlling the electric current, bath composition, and immersion time, various colors can be achieved on the aluminum strips or wires with stable and constant results. </summary>

<summary> The present invention describes a process for producing transgenic plants with a desired DNA sequence integrated into their chromosomes. This process involves assembling the DNA sequence of interest in planta from precursor vectors through site-specific recombination. The assembled DNA sequence contains necessary elements for expressing a function of interest. Different vectors can be used to generate a variety of DNA sequences of interest, allowing for screening of libraries for desired traits. The process also allows for the removal of unnecessary foreign DNA sequences and the creation of derivative vectors with allelic relationships. Overall, this process provides a rapid, efficient, and versatile method for transforming plants with stable and inheritable genetic modifications. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a swash plate type compressor for compressing refrigerant gas by rotating a swash plate. An improvement is made by applying a fluorocarbon coating on the swash plate to reduce frictional wear. The coating allows for the use of lower cost alloy materials while maintaining durability and efficiency. The coating is a heat curable, cross-linked coating comprising a polyfluoro elastomer, lubricious additive, and load bearing additive. The coating is applied to roughened surfaces on the swash plate and cured in an oven at an elevated temperature. Experimental results show that the coated swash plates have higher seizure loads and lower friction coefficients compared to uncoated swash plates. The coating provides durability and low friction properties without the need for expensive base materials or complex electroplating processes. The coating is suitable for both hypereutectic and non-hypereutectic aluminum swash plates, offering a cost-effective and efficient solution for swash plate compressors.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to organic polymers for anti-reflective coatings on semiconductor devices, specifically for preventing light reflection during photolithography processes using short wavelength light sources. The polymers absorb light at 193 nm and 248 nm wavelengths, eliminating standing wave effects and reflection/diffraction. The invention provides novel chemical compounds, preparation methods, anti-reflective coating compositions, and coating formation methods. Polymers are synthesized with diazonaphthoquinonesulfonyl groups, and compositions may include light-absorbing compounds. The polymers form a cross-linked structure when coated and baked, providing stable anti-reflective coatings for semiconductor devices. The use of these polymers improves product yield and stability in submicro-pattern formation processes for semiconductors.</summary>

<summary> The invention describes a white, flame-retardant, UV-resistant, thermoformable film made from a crystallizable thermoplastic. The film includes white pigment, flame retardant, and UV absorber, and has good orientability and mechanical properties. The film can be produced cost-effectively and is suitable for outdoor applications. The film passes fire tests and has high UV resistance. The film can be thermoformed without predrying and is suitable for a variety of applications.</summary>

<summary> The present invention describes a method for producing 143a through continuous gas phase hydrofluorination of 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane using heterogeneous catalysis. The process achieves very high conversion and selectivity for 143a, exceeding 99%. Various catalysts, including CrF3 and Cr/Ni/AlF3, are used to efficiently convert 142b to 143a. The process can also remove olefinic byproducts, such as 1130a, 1131a, and 1132a, from the final product. Adiabatic reactors are employed to carry out the hydrofluorination process at different temperatures and pressures, resulting in high conversion rates and minimal olefin formation. The method demonstrates the feasibility of using a combination of 141b and 142b as co-feeds for the hydrofluorination process. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a process for deacylation and desulfurization of compounds to improve product yield and reduce impurities. Pyrazolotriazoles are difficult to synthesize but are useful in photographic products. The process involves using hypophosphorous acid to reduce elemental sulfur and sulfur-containing impurities. The process is conducted at specific temperatures and pressures with the addition of hydrochloric acid and hypophosphorous acid. The compounds used in the process have specific characteristics to ensure stability and reactivity. Examples of the process show high yields and purity of the desired product. The process can be adapted for various compounds and reactions. Overall, the use of hypophosphorous acid in the process provides several advantages and improvements in the synthesis of pyrazolotriazoles. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming fiber mixtures by sequentially taking partial quantities from different fiber lots. The method involves measuring the total quantity of fiber in each lot, determining a partial quantity to be removed, and continuously removing only the calculated quantity from each lot. The apparatus includes a bale opener, a quantity measuring device, and a control device to ensure precise removal of fiber quantities. The method eliminates fiber residuals, ensures an optimally homogeneous mixture, and can be time-controlled to maintain a predetermined schedule for fiber removal.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a method and apparatus for forming bias laid, non-woven fabrics with yarns laid at angles of 30Â° to 150Â° to the long axis of the fabric. The fabrics are held together by stitching, knitting, or adhesive bonding. The process involves using rake mechanisms synchronized with conveyors to ensure parallelism of yarns in each layer. Overlapping of yarn courses can be controlled to adjust fabric density. The apparatus includes conveyors with needles, yarn carriers, and rake systems for yarn placement. The resulting fabric is used for structural parts and can be impregnated with resin for added strength. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method and apparatus for inserting different weft threads in a multiple-color air jet loom with varying weft carrying forces. Prior looms used uniform air pressure for all weft threads, resulting in wasted air and varying insertion speeds. The invention allows for different air pressures or ejection times to produce appropriate weft carrying forces for each thread. Different embodiments show variations in subnozzle arrangements, pressure regulation, and main nozzle control. The system ensures stable weft insertion, reduced air consumption, and improved efficiency in weaving different types of fabric. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a bast fibre yarn obtained through spinning bast fibres, with a process involving health-preserving the fibres to improve flexibility and reduce breakage rates. The process includes steps such as opening, cleaning, carding, and spinning the fibres, with variations in temperature, humidity, and duration of health preservation. Various experiments with different fibre blends and preservation conditions show a significant reduction in end breakage rates, improving work efficiency and product quality. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to nip presses used in various industries, particularly in papermaking, to measure and remove rotational variability from the nip pressure profile. The invention involves placing multiple sets of sensors at different cross-directional positions along the sensing roll to measure pressure as it enters the nip region. By averaging the readings from corresponding sensors at each position, a more accurate nip pressure profile can be calculated. Different configurations of sensors, such as pairs spaced 180Â° apart or sets spaced 120Â° or 90Â° apart, can be used to cancel out rotational variability. The sensors can be connected to a transmitter for wireless data transmission to a processing unit, which can display the nip pressure profile and make corrective adjustments to the sensing roll. Graphical displays show how different sensor configurations can reduce rotational variability and improve the accuracy of the nip pressure profile. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a combination electrical cord support and article holder for an ironing board. The apparatus includes a clamp for securing it to the ironing board, a flexible cord support for supporting the electrical cord of an iron, and a detachable article holder. The clamp has a threaded bolt for adjusting the clamp to the ironing board and an electrical outlet for receiving the plug of the iron. The cord support has a flexible mast with a spring section and a foot for pivotable movement. The article holder has a circular hoop with support bars and vertical supports for holding articles. The apparatus can be disassembled for storage by retracting the cord support and removing the article holder. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a buttonhole controlling device for a sewing machine that can be adjusted to sew buttonholes of different lengths based on the type of material being used. The device includes a foot pad, a travelling assembly with a slidable member for positioning a button, and an adjustable stop to control the length of the buttonhole stitches. By adjusting the stop, operators can ensure that buttonholes are sewn neatly without overlap, regardless of the material being used. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to an apparatus for treating a dyed or printed textile web with a liquid, improving washing efficiency without stacking the fabric. The apparatus includes a conveyor, liquid applicator, suction device, and dwell stretch for spreading out the textile web. The dwell stretch can be an air pass or a drum system, allowing the liquid to act on the fabric for a longer time. The apparatus is compact and suitable for various materials, providing effective washing without damaging printed designs. The design allows for easy recycling of the washing liquid and can be adapted for different applications. </summary>

<summary> The document describes a dry cleaning machine with separate air flow and solvent flow systems, controlled by a timer, to minimize the escape of solvent vapors and ensure efficient cleaning and drying of clothes. The machine includes a refrigeration system for condensing solvent vapors, controls for a "cartridge dry" operation to dry filter cartridges, and safety features to prevent solvent vapor leakage. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to an improved method and apparatus for forming fine continuous filaments, particularly in the production of melt spun nonwoven webs. The system involves a quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the machine width to produce a linear plane of filaments with uniform distribution. The system eliminates the need for separate air sources for quenching and drawing, simplifying the process and improving energy transfer efficiency. The method allows for easy adjustment of filament denier by changing the slot opening size, air flow rate, or other parameters. The resulting nonwoven webs have improved uniformity, strength, and elongation, making them suitable for various applications. The system is flexible and can accommodate a wide range of materials and operating conditions, providing a more efficient and cost-effective solution compared to conventional systems. </summary>

<summary> The source document discusses various embodiments of a sewing machine system that allows users to easily specify a sewing position on a work cloth using an ultrasonic pen. In the first embodiment, the sewing machine includes receivers that detect ultrasonic waves transmitted from the pen, enabling precise identification of the specified position. The second embodiment introduces an embroidery unit with receivers attached to the carriage, providing flexibility in positioning the receivers for accurate detection. The third embodiment eliminates the need for a cable connection by using an electromagnetic wave output circuit in the pen and an electromagnetic wave detector in the sewing machine. The fourth embodiment adds an additional receiver on the pillar of the sewing machine for improved accuracy in identifying the specified position. Overall, these embodiments offer innovative solutions for precise sewing position identification without the need for markers or manual adjustments.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to preparations for enhancing the utility of cellulosic fabric materials by using ultrafine wool powder or bamboo powder as carriers for functional additives. These preparations improve properties such as ultraviolet protection, moisture management, wicking, and wrinkle recovery of the fabric materials. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is an automatic quilting machine for stitching patterns into large fabrics like bedspreads and quilts. It includes separate computers to control the sewing machine functions and the frame table movements, allowing for independent reprogramming. The system also incorporates a computer aided design program for creating and duplicating patterns, simplifying the process of sewing intricate designs. By segregating the control of sewing functions and table movements, the invention increases efficiency and productivity in quilting operations. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric with a three-dimensional image for various consumer applications. Traditional textile fabric production involves multiple steps, while nonwoven fabrics are more efficient as they are produced directly from the carding process. Nonwoven fabrics can be reinforced with support layers like spunbond material to improve physical properties. Hydroentanglement techniques can impart images or patterns to nonwoven fabrics, enhancing their physical properties and appearance. The method involves providing precursor webs with different fibrous matrices and a support layer, then subjecting them to hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device. The resulting fabric can be used in various applications like hygiene products, medical supplies, cleaning wipes, and protective covers. The invention allows for the creation of durable nonwoven fabrics with unique properties and enhanced imaging capabilities. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric. It includes a stop in the feed path of the strip that can be retracted and controlled by a signal transmitter. The device ensures continuous operation, can handle stiff strips of material, and is insensitive to disturbances. The device operates by moving the stop into position when the strip is fed correctly, triggering the necessary switching processes for starting the sewing operation. The invention provides a simple, rugged, and economical solution for feeding strip materials in sewing machines. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a knitting method and knit fabric for linking rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garments. Traditional methods involve sewing the knit fabric together, leading to increased thickness and decreased productivity. The new method involves knitting two tape-shaped pieces on a flat knitting machine with movable needle beds, overlaying loops at the boundary, and gradually binding them off to connect the pieces. The process is repeated until the two pieces are fully connected. The method prevents the end portion from loosening and ensures a secure join. The detailed description includes diagrams illustrating the knitting process step by step. The method can be applied to various garments and the transfers are controlled by a computer following a designed knitting pattern. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a flexible traction element for lifts, comprising stranded cables sheathed in a flexible thermoplastic material. A production line is described for embedding the cables in the material, ensuring precise positioning and adhesion. The method involves preheating the cables, sheathing them in the extruder with the material, and ensuring long-term adhesion. The resulting traction elements are flexible, durable, and suitable for various applications, such as lift bands. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, designed to minimize hindrance to the guiding and pull-back of the needle thread loop. The arrangement includes cams and a spring rod to prevent rotation of the bobbin housing, as well as a capsule release device for counter-rotating the bobbin housing. This design allows for smooth and unhindered movement of the needle thread loop during stitching. The use of the capsule release device reduces needle thread tension, resulting in improved sewing properties. Overall, the rotary hook arrangement is simple, rugged, and cost-effective to manufacture. </summary>

<summary> The invention provides methods for producing silicon-based nanowire materials using liquid silane inks through electrospinning. Different formulations of inks were tested, resulting in the formation of nanowires that were characterized through various post-deposition treatments. The produced nanowires showed potential for use in applications such as lithium ion battery anodes. The methods demonstrated the versatility and effectiveness of using liquid silane inks for producing silicon-based nanowires. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to an arrangement for controlling thread tension in a spool creel with multiple spool holders, each equipped with a brake rotor and adjustable braking element controlled by a tensioning lever biased by the departing thread. Existing creel arrangements automatically decrease braking force as spool wind diameter reduces. The invention allows for individual and overall thread tension control in the creel using fluid pressure-sensitive biasing arrangements connected to the tensioning levers. A pneumatic biasing arrangement, piston/cylinder assembly, and magnetic system are used to influence tensioning lever movement and alter thread tension. The arrangement also includes a braking shoe for rapid braking action when the warping machine is shut off. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a sewing machine detector that detects the position of the sewing needle and the speed of the machine. It includes light shielding discs mounted on a shaft, optical fiber supporters for fixing optical fibers, and a module section with light emitting and receiving devices. The detector accurately detects signals for needle position, machine speed, and thread trimmer timing, while minimizing stress on the optical fibers. The use of stationary reflecting portions and linear optical fiber support reduces vibration-related issues and ensures stable operation. Additionally, the detector includes a power indicating light system that does not interfere with the control circuitry of the sewing machine. </summary>

<summary> 
The present invention relates to a process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness. The process involves completing coagulation, washing the yarn with water of non-alkaline pH, and drying the yarn to achieve a degree of white not lower than 45. The coagulation index is defined as the number of moles of CS2 per 100 anhydroglucosidic groups of cellulose. The process results in a finished yarn with high whiteness without the need for additional treatments. The wash water used should have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5 and be free from certain cations. The process allows for faster production and reduced space requirements on spinning machines. The invention also includes a method for obtaining the required wash water using weakly acid ion exchange resins. The process leads to yarn with improved mechanical characteristics and a high degree of white. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a deaeration tank for washing pulp after oxygen bleaching, solving the problem of foam formation in the washer. The tank is small, with no moving parts, and is placed on top of the oxygen reactor. It has an inlet pipe, outlet, and swirl inducing inlet pipe for optimal deaeration. The system uses filtrate from the washer as the swirling fluid in the tank. The tank is cylindrical, closed, and can withstand pressure or vacuum. The height of the slurry in the tank is controlled by a sensor, and the body of slurry is swirled by the filtrate. The tank is designed for efficient deaeration of pulp before washing, improving the overall bleaching process. </summary>

The invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials designed for high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio. The materials are optimized using a function-oriented material design process, incorporating tendon elements, stuffer members, and joints. The BTR composites can be constructed with various panel shapes, tendon materials, and configurations to achieve optimal structural performance.

<summary> The invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames in structures to dissipate energy during dynamic events. The device may undergo plastic deformation to limit loads on the structure and can be easily replaced after deformation. The device is designed to withstand high lateral loads and form plastic hinges to dissipate energy. Different geometries of the device can be used for various bracing configurations, and it can be externally mounted on structures. An indicator may be used to detect plastic deformation after a dynamic event. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a unit type bedroom cabinet designed for flophouse facilities in existing buildings. The bedroom cabinet is assembled in a box shape with an outer casing and an inner casing, providing mechanical strength. Boxes for devices and shelves for belongings are integrated within the cabinet without protruding. The outer surfaces of the cabinet are flat, allowing for easy stacking or installation of multiple cabinets. Ventilation and sound-proofing are achieved through a clearance between the outer and inner casings. Spacer members with vent grooves are used to create an air flow passage around the inner casing, enhancing ventilation and sound-proofing. The cabinet also features a retractable sheet for covering the mat and various storage options for users. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a portable guard rail support for use in construction sites to provide safety barriers. The guard rail support includes rail supporting brackets, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring. The system allows for easy assembly and disassembly, meets safety guidelines, and can be used in various construction environments. </summary>

<summary> The invention pertains to the stimulation of crude oil reservoirs using pulsed power electrohydraulic and electromagnetic methods. The method involves generating acoustic and electromagnetic-acoustic vibrations to enhance oil flow and increase oil recovery. Existing methods for oil recovery have limitations in range and frequency, which the present invention aims to overcome. The invention includes a pulsed power device for EOR, capable of releasing high power output for industrial applications. The method involves using multiple sources in multiple wells to stimulate oil production effectively. The invention also includes methods for separating components of recovered fluids, such as hydrocarbons, gases, and impurities. Various separation methods, including membrane processes and cryogenic separation, can be used to separate components from recovered fluids. Additionally, methods for recovering heavy metals and other materials from recovered fluids are included in the invention. The invention aims to improve oil recovery and enhance the efficiency of oil field operations.</summary>

<summary> The document describes a splice for extending the length of a soil reinforcing element used in Mechanically Stabilized Earth (MSE) structures. The splice includes wave plates with transverse protrusions to receive transverse wires from the soil reinforcing element and a grid-strip. A connective device secures the splice, preventing the wires from escaping. Multiple splices and grid-strips can be used to create a composite soil reinforcing element of the desired length. The disclosure provides a detailed description of the splice design and its application in MSE structures. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a plow blade design with fluid passage and ejection points for efficient installation of utility lines. Different embodiments include variations in the placement of the fluid tube, leading edge sections, and nozzles to control fluid flow rates and locations. The design allows for easy customization and efficient production using traditional manufacturing processes. </summary>

<summary> The present invention is a building system for stucco type cavity wall construction, allowing for panels of greater height and width without movement joints. The system includes battens, mesh reinforcement, plaster matrix, and various flashings for openings. The system meets building code requirements for structural integrity, durability, fire resistance, and moisture control. Components such as battens, mesh, plaster, and sealants are specified for use in the system. The system also includes provisions for movement control joints, reinforcement at corners and openings, and waterproofing measures. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to safes for valuable papers and articles, with prior art including wall and floor safes embedded in concrete or free-standing. Various patents describe different safe structures, including ones with laminated doors, lateral insertion doors, and tamper-proof cabinets. The present invention provides a safe with a rectangular valuables chamber and a steel door that is inserted and locked in place using grooves and a lockbolt. The door is reinforced with safety bolts to prevent damage from prying attempts. Another embodiment of the safe includes a liner with grooves for the door and fins for structural integrity, along with a lock notch for the lockbolt. The safe construction is simple yet effective, providing a secure locking mechanism for protecting valuables. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to monitoring fluid pressures in geological formations accurately and without being influenced by pressures in the formation above and below the measuring apparatus. Traditional piezometers and pressure transducers have limitations in accurately measuring formation pressures. The invention involves cementing a conduit with a filter at the bottom end in a borehole, pressurizing the conduit to clear it of cement grout, and displacing the grout to establish a fluid connection with the formation. This method isolates the pressure sensor in the borehole and ensures accurate measurement of formation pressures at the desired depth. Another embodiment involves fracturing the formation to create a communication path between the filter and the formation, allowing the pressure transducer to measure the formation pressure accurately. The pressure transducer can be relocated within the conduit for calibration or to suit different pressure ranges. The invention provides a reliable and accurate method for monitoring fluid pressures in geological formations.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints with an expansion function and a method of mounting an elastic member. It aims to prevent tire fall-in and stuck-in situations, ensure smooth vehicle traveling, and facilitate maintenance. The structure includes laminated rubbers, a joint block, and supporting blocks, all fitted in detachable fashion. The method involves joining the elastic members, fixing them in place, and allowing for deformation to absorb bridge girder expansion or contraction.</summary>

The invention relates to an enclosed floor track system for transporting wheeled hand trucks in a fluid treatment chamber without contaminating the environment, allowing for the quick cooling of meat products with a brine solution. The system prevents contamination of the brine solution by segregating the wheels of the hand trucks from the treatment fluid, facilitating the recovery and reuse of the solution.

<summary> The lock device of the present invention prevents a work machine from tilting due to its weight, specifically preventing a backhoe boom from rotating downward. The device includes an engaging member on the boom or boom bracket, an engaged member on the other, and a guide member to keep the engaging member in place. The lock plate can be easily operated manually, with features such as a hook part, slot, support pin, and guide member. The device ensures stability and prevents damage to the lock mechanism, making it suitable for use in construction machines like excavators, loaders, and cranes. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with a flexible platform that allows for precise regulation of suction efficiency during pool cleaning. It includes adjustment mechanisms on the vacuum head to regulate the spacing between the suction portion and the pool bottom. The device can be easily retrofitted to existing pool cleaning devices for improved suction regulation. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to an apparatus for retrieving wear bushings from oil well drilling tools. The apparatus includes a sub-unit mounted onto the drill string and a retriever section for engaging the wear bushing. The retriever section is circular in shape with protruding members for engaging the wear bushing. The apparatus allows for vertical movement of the retriever unit while preventing rotational movement. It can be easily installed and removed for quick retrieval of the wear bushing. The apparatus can be threadably engaged between two sections of drill pipe without removing the drill bit. An alternative embodiment includes a retriever section with a threaded end for engaging a threaded wear bushing. The apparatus prevents damage to the wear bushing and allows for efficient retrieval during drilling operations. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a vibratory tool for downhole use that allows passage for wireline or other tools to pass through. The tool features a modular stacked piston design to increase power delivery, an annular dump valve to prevent slamming against a seat, and a simple plug to initiate operation. The tool can be operated with or without impacts on each cycle, depending on the applied overpull force. Overall, the tool provides a more economical and reliable design for dislodging stuck objects in downhole locations. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to a precast concrete retaining wall system with a face panel and integral counterfort for increased stability. The system allows for taller walls and shorter bases, with pre-manufactured components that can be easily assembled on site. Various embodiments include features such as drainage openings, rebar reinforcements, connections with grout, and options for additional stability measures like H-piles or vehicle impact barriers. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to systems and methods for delivering heat at the down hole end of oil or gas wells to improve production. Existing heating systems have shortcomings in focusing heat and protecting electrical components from damage. The new system includes a heating unit with insulated electrical connections, heat insulating packers, and stainless steel collars to focus heat on the production zone. The method involves using the system to treat wells with high viscosity or paraffin blockages. The system can also be used with wire line instead of pipe for deep gas wells. The invention provides a more effective and reliable solution for improving flow rates in oil and gas wells. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, especially those that are stuck or lost. The mechanism includes an external pull tool or overshot and an internal pull tool or spear, both with a catch mechanism for locking and unlocking. The mechanism allows for controlled connection and disconnection with objects in the well bore without the need for jarring or mechanical vibration. The mechanism can be used for fishing operations, overshot type grappling, and engagement with standard fishing necks. The latching and unlatching cycles can be repeated indefinitely, making it efficient for various down hole service operations. Overall, the mechanism provides a simple and efficient way to install and remove objects in wells. </summary>

<summary> The example embodiment relates to a method for manufacturing composed stave floors with improved durability. The method involves using a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm, assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means. The multidirectional holding means include dendrites, adhesion, horizontal reinforcement means, and vertical reinforcement means to prevent displacement or deformation. The example embodiment aims to preserve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the floors, providing increased durability and the ability for corrective maintenance. The method addresses drawbacks of conventional stave floors, offering a solution for enhancing the lifespan and quality of composed stave floors.</summary>

<summary> The invention relates to ladder attachments that improve stability, prevent defacing of work surfaces, and allow ladders to straddle corners. The attachments include large contact area braces with resilient pad assemblies and U-bolts to secure them to ladder rungs. The braces can be adjusted to fit different ladder sizes and can pivot horizontally to straddle corners. The design prevents the ladder from slipping or sliding, increases contact area with the work surface, and avoids damaging the surface. The attachments are easy to install and can be used on various types of ladders. Overall, the invention provides a solution to common ladder stability and surface damage issues. </summary>

<summary> The present invention pertains to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material is molded onto and adhered to the fasteners, reducing debris generation and increasing holding power. Various configurations of the collation system, including tapered collars, embossed patterns, and selectively weakened regions, are designed to minimize debris and enhance the performance of the fastener assembly. </summary>

<summary> The invention is a nozzle for applying sealants, such as silicones, in various industries like aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. The nozzle includes a bell-shaped lower section and an injection button with channels and orifices for precise sealant application. It allows for manual or automated sealant application, improving efficiency and quality in sealing operations. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a position sensor system for monitoring moving objects, particularly in mechanical systems like internal combustion engines. The system includes a waveform generator and error correction generator to provide a conditioned sensing signal to a remote monitoring system via two wires. The system eliminates static signals and error signals, constantly comparing the sensor output to a desired minimum value for accurate monitoring. The sensor system also includes a window reference circuit and a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation for efficient operation. Overall, the sensor system allows for multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with minimal energy consumption. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust functions in internal combustion engines. The system eliminates the need for springs and allows for infinitely variable valve displacement. The system controls the opening and closing of valves with precision and efficiency, improving engine performance and fuel consumption. By adjusting the angle of the drive slot, the valve displacement can be controlled from fully open to fully closed. The system can be computer-controlled to optimize engine performance based on vehicle operation. Multiple valves per cylinder can also be controlled using the same drive link mechanism. Overall, the system offers a simple, robust, and effective solution for valve actuation in internal combustion engines. </summary>

<summary> The source document describes a light member for aquariums and other applications, using LEDs for lighting. The light member includes a housing with a top and bottom side, a lighting control region with multiple control channels for different colors of light, and switches for controlling the channels. Modules with LEDs emitting white or blue light can be coupled to the lighting control region. The modules are slim and square in shape, with electrical connectors for easy installation. Some modules include RF communication for remote control. In-line timers can be used to control the light member, and the light member can also be mounted under cabinets with additional features like optics for adjusting light angles. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to a cooled flow deflection apparatus for a fluid-flow machine operating at high temperatures, such as a gas turbine blade. Traditional flow deflection apparatuses use internal cooling channels to reduce metal temperatures. The known apparatuses have disadvantages like difficult cooling in transitional regions and high material weight. The invention introduces separate inserts for separating walls in the cooling channels, replacing the traditional cast walls. These inserts are inserted into the apparatus and secured, offering advantages like reduced thermal stresses and weight, simplified production, and adjustable cooling systems. The inserts can be straight or U-shaped, and can be connected to the apparatus for security. The invention is particularly beneficial for gas turbine blades, simplifying their design and production.</summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a system and method for controlling a fuel delivery system for a vehicle, allowing for automatic or manual control. The system includes a control unit that processes signals indicating accelerator pedal position and throttle valve position to set the throttle for optimal performance. A DC motor or stepper motor is used to control the throttle valve based on the signals processed by the control unit. The system allows for smooth switching between automatic and manual control without causing the vehicle to lurch or stall. Manual control is achieved by engaging a clutch to connect the accelerator pedal directly to the throttle valve. The system ensures full operation of the vehicle in manual mode and does not compromise safety. The control system can also be used in conjunction with a continuously variable transmission for optimal performance. Various subroutines and logic sequencers are used to control the operation of the system. </summary>

<summary> The invention pertains to methods and apparatus for generating heat from particulate-laden gas or waste fuels like wood waste. Conventional hog fuel burners have been inefficient and polluting, requiring frequent cleaning and maintenance. The waste fuel burner described in the document aims to emit minimal particulate materials, operate with little slag or clinkers, and burn wet wood effectively. By utilizing primary and secondary combustion chambers with controlled air flow, the burner can achieve clean combustion and meet environmental emission standards. The burner's unique design allows for quick response times, efficient fuel burning, and minimal maintenance, making it a versatile and effective solution for various industrial applications. </summary>

The invention pertains to evaporative refrigeration systems that cool air without adding water vapor, achieving sensible cooling. By utilizing return air from the load as the working fluid on the wet side of the heat exchanger, the system achieves higher efficiency and lower energy consumption compared to vapor compression refrigeration units. A hybrid system is also described, where a portion of the cooled air is dehumidified by passing it over the evaporator coil of a vapor compression refrigeration unit, further enhancing cooling efficiency.

<summary> The document describes a fluid pump with multiple pump heads arranged in series to pump fluid from a reservoir. Each pump head contains an impeller driven by a common drive structure passing through the pump heads. The pump heads are connected by combiners to combine fluid flow before exiting the pump. The pump can be mounted on a support structure such as a wheeled boom, hitching assembly, or trailer for operation at a fluid reservoir. The design allows for modularity and ease of maintenance, with the ability to add more pump heads for increased operating pressure. </summary>

<summary> The invention relates to engine compression release brakes for less than all engine cylinders, reducing excess components and improving engine robustness. The engine includes an engine housing with a plurality of cylinders, each with a movable piston and connected to hydraulically and mechanically actuated devices. A portion of the cylinders have engine compression release brakes connected to the exhaust valve for engine braking. The engine brake system includes a solenoid, valve members, and a piston to control the opening and closing of the exhaust valve during engine braking. The electronic control module determines which cylinders operate in a braking mode, activating the engine brake during the compression stroke of the piston. The engine brake is deactivated after providing the desired engine braking, allowing the piston to continue its reciprocating movement. Modifications to the engine brake structure and orientation are possible, providing flexibility and modularity for different engine configurations. The invention allows customers to choose and pay for the desired amount of braking horsepower for specific applications. </summary>

<summary> The present invention relates to a mounting link between an engine structure and an attached structure such as an auxiliary gearbox in aircraft gas turbine engines. Extreme loads, such as blade-off events, can cause damage to gearboxes and peripheral systems, leading to potential oil leakages. A link assembly is described, consisting of a male link, a female link, and a pin to selectively retain the links. The female link receives the male link to allow translation and forms a radial interface to dampen motion. The pin serves as a fusible link, shearing under extreme loads to allow relative translation of the links. The radial interface provides coulomb damping to dissipate energy during translation. The use of the pin and radial interface eliminates the need for all linkages to withstand extreme loads, reducing weight and material requirements. The pin can be replaced during maintenance following any shock that breaks it. Various modifications and alterations are possible within the scope of the described embodiments. </summary>

<summary> This invention relates to archery equipment and methods for attaching arrow points and balancing arrow shafts. The point cap system provides adjustable weight for perfect balance, while reducing material and weight of arrow points. The balance pin can be adjusted to balance an arrow shaft, working in conjunction with the point cap. Means are provided to attach points to arrow shafts without allowing dirt to enter. The invention also allows for easy replacement of damaged point caps without rendering the arrow shaft useless. The use of external threads at the end of the cap reduces stress on graphite shafts. The invention also includes point adaptors for different types of arrow points and a nock cap for attaching nocks to arrow shafts. The balance pin can be used with arrow points or point caps to adjust point weight. Overall, the invention improves the attachment and balance of arrow points on arrow shafts. </summary>

The invention is a cost-effective pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for small arms training, utilizing an electronically controlled system with plastic expendables containing pyrotechnic charges. The simulator provides a realistic simulation of small arms fire noise and flash, without dangerous pressurization of the ignition chamber, and is designed for use with actual weapons for realistic training.

<summary> The present invention relates to an air intake device for internal combustion engines that utilizes the dynamic effects of air flow to improve engine performance while reducing intake noise. The device includes a tank, two pipes interconnecting the tank with the air intake passage, and a valve with an actuator responsive to engine operating conditions. The cross-sectional area of the second pipe is smaller than the first pipe, and the second pipe opens closer to the air cleaner than the first pipe. The valve is controlled based on engine speed and load to optimize engine performance. The narrow passage in the second pipe acts as a resonator to absorb intake noise. The valve operation is determined by the intersection of volumetric efficiency curves and engine load conditions. The valve is preferably closed at low engine speeds and loads, and opened at higher speeds and loads for improved performance. </summary>
